thread.title: Yankees clinch playoff spot after 2-year absence, top Boston
thread.title_full: Yankees clinch playoff spot after 2-year absence, top Boston

author: RONALD BLUM
title: Yankees clinch playoff spot after 2-year absence, top Boston
text:
Kathy Willens Yankees clinch playoff spot after 2-year absence, top Boston 
New York Yankees Carlos Beltran, right, points skyward as he crosses the plate after hitting a second-inning, solo, home run off Boston Red Sox starting pitcher Rich Hill in a baseball game in New York, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015. Red Sox catcher Sandy Leon is at left. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Kathy Willens Yankees clinch playoff spot after 2-year absence, top Boston 
New York Yankees on-deck batter John Ryan Murphy greets Yankees Carlos Beltran after Beltran hit a second-inning, solo home run off Boston Red Sox starting pitcher Rich Hill in a baseball game in New York, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Kathy Willens Yankees clinch playoff spot after 2-year absence, top Boston 
New York Yankees starting pitcher CC Sabathia (52) struggles with his cap in the rain during the first inning of a baseball game against the Boston Red Sox in New York, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Kathy Willens Yankees clinch playoff spot after 2-year absence, top Boston 
New York Yankees John Ryan Murphy scores on Brendan Ryan's second-inning, RBI single ahead of the throw to Boston Red Sox catcher Sandy Leon in a baseball game in New York, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Kathy Willens Yankees clinch playoff spot after 2-year absence, top Boston 
New York Yankees Carlos Beltran, left, trots the bases as Boston Red Sox starting pitcher Rich Hill looks to the outfield after allowing a second-inning, solo, home run to Beltran in a baseball game in New York, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Posted: Thursday, October 1, 2015 7:29 pm Yankees clinch playoff spot after 2-year absence, top Boston Associated Press | 
NEW YORK (AP) â€” The New York Yankees clinched an AL wild-card spot Thursday night, ending a two-year absence from the postseason by beating the Boston Red Sox 4-1. 
Carlos Beltran and rookies Greg Bird and Rob Refsnyder all homered for the Yankees in the franchise's 10,000th regular-season win.
